intro: Aquilegia amaliae var. taygetea, commonly known as the Taygetean columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It features striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to purple, with intricate patterns on the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with compound leaves that are doubly pinnate and covered in soft, hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable addition to woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique flower structure and vibrant hues, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
